Taken as a whole, current evidence suggests women exhibit stronger immune response to viral infections than men. This response typically manifests as better long-term outcomes and to subsequent reexposure but also as more severe disease acutely. The size of the effect can be substantial; in the H1N1 pandemic, infected women suffered more than 2-fold risk of death than men.
